cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.NE. 

The paper deals with the problem of robust adaptive beamforming of signals received by a linear array, which is a common problem in signal processing and communication systems. The paper proposes a regularized least-squares approach to estimate the two vectors required for beamforming, without exploiting prior information. This problem is closely related to several sub-fields of computer science, including information theory (cs.IT), signal processing (cs.SP), machine learning (cs.LG), and networked systems (cs.NE). Additionally, the paper deals with the problem of ill-conditioned covariance matrices, which is a common issue in statistical inference and optimization problems, making the sub-category of statistical inference (cs.SI) also a likely fit.
